reason: Drops in class with cheekpieces; former winner here and looks set to bounce back at value odds.
Course winner making handicap debut off a lenient mark; well worth an each-way play in a winnable race.
Consistent form, well-treated at the weights; could land the spoils if the favourite underperforms.
Multiple wins this season, beat rivals in last run, strong early pace; overpriced each-way shout.
Caught the eye behind the same rivals last time; unexposed and could go close on soft ground.
Big-field maiden form has worked out well; first handicap looks well-placed with winning potential.
Consistent filly with proven stamina and Racing League form; capable of a podium finish again.
Dropped in class, stays strongly, form boosted last time; looks underestimated in the market.
Has run well in recent starts, gets jockey claim, and could spring a surprise in a deep field.
Classy veteran bouncing back to form; soft ground and strong pace bring him into the equation.
Lightly raced 3yo with upside and solid 6f form; could stay the 7f and sneak into the places.
Consistent 5f sprinter who rarely runs a bad race; proven at this level and looks a strong e/w play.
In-form sprinter with closing speed and value profile; soft ground a positive for this late runner.
Back-class in listed company; eased in weights and looks dangerous if ground doesn't turn testing.
Respected based on previous soft-ground win; booking of 3lb claimer keeps him competitive here.
Reliable mid-field handicapper who thrives in big fields; looks primed to pounce late from off the pace.
Form is better than it appears and drops in class; soft ground suits and gets capable 5lb claimer.
In-form mare off light weight; model sees her as big raw value against exposed rivals.
Well-handicapped consistent hurdler who could pick up the pieces in strongly run contest.
Returned to form last two runs and slips in weight; worth chancing at fair odds in open finale.
